moves.1. e4 e5 2. Bc4 Nf6 3. d3: I think that f4 is also playable...
moves.5. Nxe5 d6 6. Nxf7: ?? two pieces are almost always better than a rook. 6. Nf3 was needed.
moves.6... Rxf7 7. Bxf7+ Kxf7 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bxf: Black is looking ok in this position. white has gained nothing from the opening.
moves.10. O-O Nc6 11. Nc3 Qg6: trying to attack. maybe Be6 with Rf8 was a bit better.
moves.13. Qf3+ Bf5 14. exf5 Qg5: black lost a piece but the game is not lost yet.
moves.15. Nxc7 Rc8 16. Qd5+ Kf6:
??? a mate was missed here...
16... Kf8 was losing the queen.
16... Ke7 17. Rae1  Kd7 (17... Kd8 18. Ne6 ) 18. Nb5 is still lost but can play on...
